intro: Statice meyeri, commonly known as Meyer's sea thrift, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Plumbagaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and profuse blue or purple flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils. Meyer's sea thrift is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
